tm.DataHandler (tabularmagic.Analyzer)

The DataHandler class handles data loading, saving, and preprocessing in the background for the Analyzer class.

class tabularmagic.DataHandler(df_train: DataFrame, df_test: DataFrame, name: str | None = None, verbose: bool = True)[source]

DataHandler: handles all aspects of data preprocessing and loading.

Adds a scaler for the target variable.

  • var (str.) – Name of the variable.

drop_highly_missing_vars(threshold: float = 0.5) → DataHandler[source]

Drops columns with more than 50% missing values (computed on train) in-place for both the working train and test DataFrames.

Parameters:

threshold (-) – above which a column is dropped.

dropna(include_vars: list[str] | None = None, exclude_vars: list[str] | None = None) → DataHandler[source]

Drops rows with missing values in-place on both the working train and test DataFrames.

Parameters:

  • include_vars (-) – List of columns along which to drop rows with missing values. If None, drops rows with missing values in all columns.

  • exclude_vars (-) – List of columns along which to exclude from dropping rows with missing values. If None, no variables are excluded.

Returns:

- self

Return type:

DataHandler

force_binary(vars: list[str], pos_labels: list[str] | None = None, ignore_multiclass: bool = False) → DataHandler[source]

Forces variables to be binary (0 and 1 valued numerical variables). Does nothing if the data contains more than two classes unless ignore_multiclass is True and pos_label is specified, in which case all classes except pos_label are labeled with zero.

Parameters:

  • vars (-) –

  • pos_labels (-) – If None, the first class for each var is the positive label.

  • ignore_multiclass (-) – except pos_label are labeled with zero. Otherwise raises ValueError.

Returns:

- self

Return type:

DataHandler

head(n=5) → DataFrame[source]

Returns the first n rows of the working train DataFrame.

impute(include_vars: list[str] | None = None, exclude_vars: list[str] | None = None, numerical_strategy: Literal['median', 'mean', '5nn'] = 'median', categorical_strategy: Literal['most_frequent'] = 'most_frequent') → DataHandler[source]

Imputes missing values in-place. Imputer is fit on train DataFrame and transforms both train and test DataFrames.

Parameters:

  • include_vars (-) – List of variables to impute missing values. If None, imputes missing values in all columns.

  • exclude_vars (-) – List of variables to exclude from imputing missing values. If None, no variables are excluded.

  • numerical_strategy (-) – Default: ‘median’. Strategy for imputing missing values in numerical variables. - ‘median’: impute with median. - ‘mean’: impute with mean. - ‘5nn’: impute with 5-nearest neighbors.

  • categorical_strategy (-) – Default: ‘most_frequent’. Strategy for imputing missing values in categorical variables. - ‘most_frequent’: impute with most frequent value.

Returns:

- self

Return type:

DataHandler

kfold_emitters(y_var: str, X_vars: list[str], n_folds: int = 5, shuffle: bool = True, random_state: int = 42) → list[tabularmagic._src.data.datahandler.DataEmitter][source]

Returns a list of DataEmitter objects for cross-validation. DataEmitter objects are built from KFold (StratifiedKFold if target is categorical) applied to the working train DataFrame.

Parameters:

  • y_var (-) –

  • X_vars (-) –

  • n_folds (-) –

  • shuffle (-) –

  • random_state (-) – KFold/StratifiedKFold. Ignored if shuffle is False.

Return type:

  • list[DataEmitter]

load_data_checkpoint(checkpoint: str | None = None) → DataHandler[source]

The working train and working test DataFrames are reset to the original input DataFrames given at object initialization.

Parameters:

checkpoint (-) – Default: None. If None, sets the working DataFrames to the original DataFrames given at object initialization.

Returns:

- self

Return type:

DataHandler

numvars() → list[str][source]

Returns copy of list of numerical variables.

onehot(vars: list[str] | None = None, dropfirst: bool = True) → DataHandler[source]

One-hot encodes all categorical variables in-place. Encoder is fit on train DataFrame and transforms both train and test DataFrames.

Parameters:

  • vars (-) – If not None, only one-hot encodes the specified variables.

  • dropfirst (-) – If True, the first dummy variable is dropped.

Returns:

- self

Return type:

DataHandler

save_data_checkpoint(checkpoint: str) → DataHandler[source]

Saves the current state of the working train and test DataFrames. The state may be returned to by calling load_data_checkpoint(checkpoint).

Scales variable values.

Parameters:

  • include_vars (-) – List of variables to scale. If None, scales values in all columns.

  • exclude_vars (-) – List of variables to exclude from scaling. If None, no variables are excluded.
